BOOLEAN ByteBuffer::PreAlloc (  INT  length,
INT  capacity = 0
)  [virtual]
 

Preallocates buffer space.

Allocates at least 'length' bytes. When capacity is greater than 'length', 'capacity' bytes are allocated instead. After a successful call to PreAlloc, GetLength() will return 'length', GetCapacity() will return 'length'. Existing data is preserved.

Returns:
'TRUE' in case of success, 'FALSE' when memory allocation failed - in this case the object is not modified

BOOLEAN ByteBuffer::Reallocate (  INT  length,
INT  capacity
)  [protected]
 

BOOLEAN ByteBuffer::Reserve (  INT  capacity  )  [inline]
 

Reserves buffer space maintaining the current length.

When capacity is greater then GetCapacity() a new buffer of 'capacity' bytes is allocated. The old content and its length are preserved.

Returns:
'TRUE' in case of success, 'FALSE' when memory allocation failed - in this case the object is not modified

BOOLEAN ByteBuffer::SetLength (  INT  length  )  [virtual]
 

void ByteBuffer::Swap (  ByteBuffer &  swap_with  )  [virtual]
 

Swaps content of object with those of 'swap_with'.
